title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Hello,
 I have a MacBook A2179 after a little water damage. Corrosion occurred on elements in a circle .
[ATTACH type="full" width="816px"]59799[/ATTACH]

The current voltage is yellow, but I can't check it with clouds because I don't know where to measure it.

P5VG3S_EN is missing

[ATTACH type="full" width="400px"]59796[/ATTACH]
[ATTACH type="full" align="left" width="221px"]59800[/ATTACH]















I am asking for help in diagnosing

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
You should post which signal/voltage missing from power on sequence.
Is dificil to understand what you mean with the diagram only.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
all voltages / signals that I marked in yellow are present.

I cannot measure the voltage / signals on the little clouds because I don't know where to do it.


P5VG3S_EN is missing

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Can you do DFU revive?
Be aware of restore option, that will erase entire SSD.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
I tried many times but I can't put it in DFU. 
[URL unfurl="true"]https://mrmacintosh.com/how-to-restore-bridgeos-on-a-t2-mac-how-to-put-a-mac-into-dfu-mode/[/URL]

What can I do else?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
If you get all SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages, it should enter to DFU.
If not there could be a problem with T2.

Be sure to have a good cable.
Test if you can access other T2 machine through DFU with the same cable.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Do I need the same MacBook model?
I don't know which system was installed od damaged MacBook.

The bridgeos is in T2 or spi chip?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
You can connect with non T2 machine with Apple Configurator 2.
Just use the same macOS as in T2 machine.
If no sure which version is, then try with Catalina and Big Sur, maybe Mojave.

T2 has its firmware partition on internal SSD.
It should be detected in DFU, even if its partition is bad.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Host computer does not detect DFU :( I tried with 3 other original cables and 2 different macbooks with Catalina and big sur. This is a 2020 macbook, so it should be one of those systems.

Battery should be connected? or DFU can be working witchout the battery?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Should be detected without battery.
In fact, in DFU mode, USB-C port will stay in 5V.
Be sure to use the dedicated port in T2 machine.

BTW, someone in the forum reported a 2020 Mac Mini which came with Mojave from Apple.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
I don't know what I do wrong.
Macbook host should has  the same version of MacOS to just put another MacBook to DFU or I can put to DFU MacBook without any MacBook? 
laptop host is necessary to put another laptop into DFU mode or can I put it without any macbook?
I check power button, it is ok.
Can I check that keyboard is working correctly?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Need to install Apple Configurator 2 in other MacBook, not necessary T2 machine.
Then connect both machines; follow the steps from that webpage.

I suppose something damaged by liquid spill.
Dificil to work without boardview.
Use 820-01521 as guide, but is not so close...

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
DFU doesn't work on this machine. 
I can put in DFU another macbooks but not this one.

What can I do else?

I have just 3.3V.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
You've said to have SLPS2R and AWAKE voltages.
If machine doesn't enter into DFU, then bad T2, or is affected by corrosion.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: In theory you can force T2 to enter DFU by pulling SOC_FORCE_DFU to 1.8V.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: where can I put that 1.8v? I found one place where can I do it, resistor R8010, do you know where is it?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
I tried that in a rebel board (Air 01521) and didn't help; damaged T2, caused by liquid on audio board.
However, nothing to lose, just try it.

Force SOC_FORCE_DFU to 1V8_AWAKE with 1K pull-up.
Then connect the board alone to the other machine, trough corresponding USB-C port.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: I understand but I don't know where can I connect resistor 1K, where on the motherboard is place where can I put this 1.8v

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: I had circuit on PP5V_G3S, U6500 was burned. I removed it and the short circuit is gone.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: The board turns on now?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: unfortunately no, the power consumption is the same, the DFU still not working, no change

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
There should be bad T2.
Also possible to be corrosion between its balls, or surrounding components.

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message: perhabs the keyboard is damaged sw I'd like to try force SOC_FORCE_DFU. Where can I find point on MB to connect 1V8_AWAKE ?

title: 820-01958-A no power after water damage
message:
Very dificil without real boardview.
Compare with 01521 board.
